body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open PowerShell in the standard conhost
2. Paste the following code into the console
3. Close the spawned window and the PowerShell console window and note the time it takes to close

```
Add-Type -AssemblyName System.Windows.Forms
$Form=[System.Windows.Forms.Form]::new()
$Form.ShowDialog()
```

On my system it takes about 5 seconds to close. This slowdown also happens if you have used `Get-Help -ShowWindow` or `Out-Gridview` in that session.  
This slowdown does not happen in Windows PowerShell or if you use the Windows terminal for PowerShell.

### Expected behavior

```console
The PowerShell window instantly closes when clicking on the X.
```


### Actual behavior

```console
The PowerShell window takes 5 seconds to close when clicking on the X after having used a GUI.
```
